      • populateTableFromCSV

        public static java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> populateTableFromCSV(android.content.Context context,
                                                                                                    java.lang.String csvFileName,
                                                                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> columns)
        This method is only intended to be used for processing Zambia-EIR-DataDictionaryReporting-HIA2.csv
        Parameters:
        csvFileName -
        columns - this map has the db column name as value and the csv column no as the key
        Returns:
        each map is db row with key as the column name and value as the value from the csv file

      • getTranslatedIdentifier

        public static java.lang.String getTranslatedIdentifier(java.lang.String key)
        This util does a look up from the strings file without specifying an android resource id , rather the identifier(key) of the resource
        Parameters:
        key - a string identifier that corresponds to a key in the strings.xml file e.g. for R.string.key key is the identifier
        Returns:
        String value from resource file

      • copyDatabase

        public static void copyDatabase(java.lang.String dbName,
                                java.lang.String copyDbName,
                                android.content.Context context)
        copyDatabase function moves database file created by the app is the apps private folder to Downloads folder. From Downloads folder, it's easy to share
        Parameters:
        dbName - name of the database that was created by the app e.g. drishti.db
        copyDbName - name of the database file once copied to Downloads folder e.g. reveal.db
        context - application context when calling the function
